titles.title: Rural Health Care Protection and Improvement Act of 1993
A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act and title III of the Public Health Service Act to protect and improve the availability and quality of health care in rural areas.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S529-530)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 1/21/1993--Introduced. Rural Health Care Protection and Improvement Act of 1993 - Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to extend special payments under part A (Hospital Insurance) of Medicare for the operating costs of inpatient services of small, rural Medicare-dependent hospitals. Requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to provide such hospitals which have been reclassified as urban hospitals with an opportunity to decline such reclassification. Amends the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1987 to extend the rural health transition grant program. Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Secretary to make grants to demonstrate the effectiveness of outreach to populations in rural areas that do not normally seek or have adequate access to health or mental health services. Authorizes appropriations.
